author: Ben Cohen
title: Warriorsâ€™ Stephen Curry Out at Least Three Weeks With Knee Sprain
text:
Stephen Curry will be out for at least three weeks after suffering a Grade-2 sprain of his medial collateral ligament on Friday night, the Golden State Warriors said on Saturday, an injury that means the NBA star could miss the opening of the playoffs but should recover before the Warriors need him most.
The NBA postseason begins on April 14, three weeks from Saturday, when the team said that Curry will be re-evaluated. The Western Conference semifinals could start as soon as April 28 with the conference finals around May...
